hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Momentum Fade in Low-Volume Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a >3% 1-hour price spike in BTC or ETH coinciding with a major news headline (detected via news sentiment API spike), price will mean-revert significantly within the next 6 trading hours if overall market volume is below its 10-day average.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volume environments lack sustained buying pressure to maintain news-driven spikes. Moves are often driven by reactive retail flows that are quickly exhausted, leading to a fade.
entry_conditions: BTC or ETH experiences >3% absolute return in a 1-hour candle
Coincident news sentiment score spike >1.5 std dev from 7-day mean (using CryptoCompare/Alternative.me API)
Total crypto market 24h volume < 10-day moving average of volume
Entry: Short on close of the 1-hour candle following the spike candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial spike move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves another 1.5% in the direction of the initial spike

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Fewer than 40% of such signals result in a 50% retracement of the initial spike within 6 hours.
